train_facts.text: The first trains were powered by steam over 200 years ago!
Train tracks are called railways or railroads.
Some trains can go over 300 miles per hour—that’s faster than a cheetah!
Animals like elephants used to help move train cars.
Trains can cross big bridges, long tunnels, and even mountains!
The need to keep trains on time helped invent time zones.
Some trains make a “choo-choo” sound with their steam whistle.
Japan’s bullet trains are called “Shinkansen” and are super speedy.
Trains can be pulled by engines or pushed from behind.
Maglev trains float above the tracks using magnets—no wheels!
There are trains on every continent except Antarctica.
Some toy trains are modeled after real trains and even run on tracks!
